course_title: Topic Seminars: Psych: Behavior Genetics I
class_notes:
The purpose of this course is to introduce students to behavior genetics with a focus on its applications using genetic scores. Students will meet for 2.5 hours each week to partake in a 75 minute lecture/presentation followed by a short 15 minute break and then a 60 minute discussion of pre-written responses provided by the students.


(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


Seniors and honors students are allowed to enroll with the instructor's permission.  For permission, please e-mail Dr. Rohan Palmer at rohan.palmer@emory.edu.
schedule_location: T 10am-12:30pm in New Psyc Bldg 493 (36 Eagle Ro
